qas.question: Greece, Finland, Romania and Turkey use what kind of government?
In whic type of government is the leader elected?
What other country besides Greece is a constitutional monarch?
Who is elected in a constitutional monarch?

context: The post of prime minister may be encountered both in constitutional monarchies (such as Belgium, Denmark, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Malaysia, Morocco, <b2_0>Spain<b2_0/>, Sweden, Thailand, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom), and in <a0_0><a1_0>parliamentary republics<a1_0/><a0_0/> in which <b3_0>the head of state<b3_0/> is an elected official (such as Finland ,the Czech Republic, France, Greece, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Ireland, Pakistan, Portugal, Montenegro, Croatia, Bulgaria, Romania, Serbia and Turkey). See also "First Minister", "Premier", "Chief Minister", "Chancellor", "Taoiseach", "Statsminister" and "Secretary of State": alternative titles usually equivalent in meaning to, or translated as, "prime minister".
